titleStmt.title: Elisha Williams and William Wyatt to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6944

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners Elisha Williams and William Wyatt most respectfully ask a remission of a judgment rendered in the Jefferson circuit Court against them in favor of Said Commonwealth at its september term 1865 on the 5th day of september for the Sum of five hundered dollars founded on a scrie facias on a forfeited recognizance as bail of one Luther Hays charged with filony

Your petitioners saith they entered as bail for the appearance of said Hays to answer this Said charge in Said court but after they entered as bail and before the day of appearance said Hays entered the Army of the United States ^^ So that Your petitioners could not produce him
in view of the foregoing facts they ask your excellency to remit all of said judgment except the fees of the Commonwealths attorney and costs and your petitioners will every pray &c

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Remit
E. Williams & Wm Wyatt
$500.
Forfeiture
20 Sept/65
Fee paid
hand to Mr Barrett
